TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed DefaultCacheCapabilities extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Represents a set of features that a cache implementation provides.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities> class is a flag enumeration. The field values are bits and can be combined as a set of flags that describe the capabilities of the cache.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities> enumeration can be used to programmatically set the behavior of the cache implementation. This behavior is based on the combination of features that a particular cache implements.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities AbsoluteExpirations = int32(8)

Docs.summary: A cache implementation supports the ability to automatically remove cache entries at a specific date and time.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities CacheEntryChangeMonitors = int32(4)

Docs.summary: A cache implementation supports the ability to create change monitors that monitor entries.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities CacheEntryRemovedCallback = int32(64)

Docs.summary: A cache implementation can raise a notification that an entry has been removed from the cache.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities CacheEntryUpdateCallback = int32(32)

Docs.summary: A cache implementation can raise a notification that an entry is about to be removed from the cache. This setting also indicates that a cache implementation supports the ability to automatically replace the entry that is being removed with a new cache entry.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities CacheRegions = int32(128)

Docs.summary: A cache implementation supports the ability to partition its storage into cache regions, and supports the ability to insert cache entries into those regions and to retrieve cache entries from those regions.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities InMemoryProvider = int32(1)

Docs.summary: A cache implementation runs at least partially in memory. A distributed cache would not set this flag, whereas an in-memory cache such as the class would do so.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: A cache implementation does not provide any of the features that are described in the enumeration.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities OutOfProcessProvider = int32(2)

Docs.summary: A cache implementation runs out-of-process. A distributed cache would set this flag, whereas an in-memory cache such as the class would not.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities SlidingExpirations = int32(16)

Docs.summary: A cache implementation supports the ability to automatically remove cache entries that have not been accessed in a specified time span.
